Reviews.Title: “Small but clean rooms.,, Location is great!!”
Reviews.Author: NT23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with my family , I'd say that you have to organized your luggage so that you can move around.. the room was clean , service was good... that was the consolation. The location is great, 5 mins walk to MRT/ 10min walk to Sim Lim square..Bencoolen plaza/ 10 min walk to orchard. breakfast was just enough .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: oifatburger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night in Singapore and needed somewhere to sleep after shopping. Room didn't have a window, the bed was about as comfortable as sleeping on concrete and the bathroom was really a wet room with a shower almost over the toilet. The threadbare towels were great for an exfoliation after I took a shower. On the plus side this place is 2 mins from little India and about five mins walk from the bottom of orchard rd. The room was clean, air-conditioned and contained a tv. If I paid the rack price s$299 I would have felt ripped off but at s$50 it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Squeeze-inn!”
Reviews.Author: Udayadittya
Reviews.Content: I had booked for two nights at Fragrance Hotel Bugis, but on arrival was informed that on account of a power-outage that would take some time to repair, I'd be transferred to Fragrance Hotel Selegie. They called for a taxi and courteously agreed to reimburse the taxi-fare. The check-in was smooth, I was asked to pay for the second night upfront (I had earlier paid for one night during the booking), and sent to my room. This is the smallest hotel room I've ever slept in. The bed was 5'x5'6", so for two nights I slept along the diagonal to fit my 6'2" frame. Thankfully it was a business trip, so I needed to come back only to sleep. On the plus sude, the aircon was highly effective (given the room size!). The room rent included complimentary breakfast, which was served in the hotel's first-floor cafe. I went in around 8 am both days, and had to stand in queue between 10-20 minutes before the staff would guide me to a seat (they would insist on doing that, even if you can locate an empty table and want to take that)! The food was fresh, hot and filling. Overall, a manageable experience. But I value sleeping along the length of the bed, so I'm not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate rip off”
Reviews.Author: Tony R
Reviews.Content: I would never ever recommend this hotel chain to ant one unless you are looking for a short time hotel to take a street walker to. The corporate policy for bookings and cancelations is un fair and set up towards hitting unwilling punter cancelation fees above what you would expect. The hotel rooms are very small, not properly cleaned and stocked, often guests had been smoking in them so you have to put up with a stinking little room. The online booking system works but if you what to chick out early without giving them at least seven days notice you are hit with a nights room rate, this is even if you stay one night and want to check out early due to the very poor quality of the rooms you will be stung with another room nights cost. Then if you want to get a refund on your credit card you will have to wait over six weeks to get your money bank. Like I say not worth the money, not a nice experience all round...just a short time hotel

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: SinDavid
Reviews.Content: Not expect too much if you only want to pay less, you get what you pay lah. If you expect bigger space room why dont you choose marna bay sand instead ????

Reviews.Title: “A Closet for a Room”
Reviews.Author: mariloureyes2001
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue but I still have distinct memories of the hotel because our room was so small that when I was shown the room, I asked if this was the "closet". You can imagine that if the room itself was small ( it was for double occupancy by the way), the bathroom was miniature. When you took a shower, you had to orchestrate your movements carefully otherwise the water might over run to the room. Besides, you hardly had room to maneuver. To think that I am a petite 5' person. Of course, I was travelling on a budget so I suppose I got what I paid for which I understand for Singapore was quite acceptable. But I still can't get over how small the room was so that when I met a Russian ( he must have been at least 6'3" tall and a bulky build) I could not help but ask him how he managed to fit himself into the room. He replied humorously, "with much difficulty". On the plus side, the hotel was at least clean and breakfast passable. The service was o.k. perhaps because the front desk personnel were all Filipinos. I got the surprise of my life though when one of them, who looked like a Chinese, greeted us (my friend and I ) with a British accent. It was only when she overheard my friend and I talking in our native language that she informed us that she was a Filipino. Location of the hotel was in the "Indian" area of Singapore, walking distance to places of interests and shops ( if you like to walk long distances which I did ). But the hotel area had a lot of "sidewalk places" where one could enjoy Singaporean food, which I did. So if you are budget traveler, which I am most of the time, the hotel, was OK even if the room was a closet. After all, I only needed a place to sleep which was clean and had a reasonably passing breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a box, with a plastic bed and bugs this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: Claire4051
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a stop over in Singapore for 30hrs and decided to check into a cheap place by a MRT. We weren't worried if it was small as long as it was clean and we got a hot shower and good nights sleep! This is the first hotel I have stayed in that I seriously considered leaving and booking somewhere else! The rooms are tiny and extremely dirty, there are small bugs in the bathroom that looked like fruit flys. We asked to move rooms due to the bugs and the TV not working. The new room was cleaner but bathroom was covered in mold! And still a few bugs! After a terrible nights sleep in the plastic bed with a lot of noise coming from the hall we got a terrible breakfast of burnt coffee, sausage, toast and eggs. Needless to say we were very happy to check out a tad worried we were taking bed bugs with us! I know it was cheap and what did we expect but last year we paid the same to stay at the Aqueen lavender and were very happy other than the long walk to the MRT which is why we chose not to repeat our stay. Next time we will enjoy the walk from Aqueen knowing we are staying somewhere worth the 'cheap' Singapore prices!

Reviews.Title: “Some caravans are Bigger”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes3000
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend for 4 days to Singapore March 2012. We went to this hotel knowing it was small from previous reviews, But SMALL is an understatement. Although the room was clean there was nowhere to put your suitcases but on the floor. There also is no wardrobe to hang your clothes up just some hooks on the wall. ( they could do with putting a lot more hooks up seeing there is no wardrobe).So be prepared to Live out of your suitcase. Maybe if you are a solo traveller on a budget this hotel will suit you, but it is diffinetly not for friends or couples. The bathroom (if you can call it that) was like stepping into a cupboard. The toilet and washhand basin and shower are all clumped together. So when you shower the whole room gets soaked, door,walls toilet etc. When the second person wants use the room the whole place needs wiped down. Which brings me to the Thread bare towels.?? I'm glad I brought my own. and the bathroom could also use an exhast fan.Oh and Bring your own soap and shampoo they only supply toothbrushes and a shower cap. If you plan to stay here dont stay near the lift ( room 512) or 612 etc, you will hear people coming and going,conversations,the lift bell , doors slamming etc. Reason being the walls are paper thin. Oh and that reminds me the plumbing for the upper floors runs down the wall behind this room so when someone flushes on upper floors you will here it. The breakfast has limited choices, but is adequite enough to get you going in the morning On a positive Note the staff at receiption are excellent and you are only a five minute walk to the MRT underground.

Reviews.Title: “A good bet if you are looking for a budget hotel near the CBD”
Reviews.Author: OWSI
Reviews.Content: After a number of overnight stays in Singapore, I can now conclude that hotel room space (hotel room price being constant) is inversely proportional to the distance to the central business district of Singapore (i.e. Orchard Road / Marina). I recently stayed in a standard room in Fragrance Hotel Selegie and although the room is a bit tight at less than 3 meters by 3 meters, it was actually comfortable for one person. I asked for a room with a window and got one. I find the room very neat, the linens very clean. The bed sheet and pillow cases seemed to have been starched and the room is well maintained. The room had flat screen TV, hot pot, hair drier, complimentary bottled water and coffee. There is a bed side lamp and light switch. Power outlets are conveniently provided in the room. The bathroom and toilet are one and the same, so everything is wet after a shower. The breakfast is good with choices and is served in the second floor restaurant. The front desk staff are very courteous and efficient. The hotel is within the fringes of the CBD and walking distance to Orchard and the Marina. There are lots of restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood. The rooftop swimming pool looks fine and has a better view than the other Fragrance Hotel I stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean”
Reviews.Author: snooky04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5days & 4nights with family. All staff is easy to accommodate, the location is great because it is near the ATM cards, convenient stores, restaurants and cafeteria. There is additional charge for wifi. The room is clean and great facilities, with hot and cold shower, cable and phone, free coffee and water. The free breakfast is great even though limited choices only. Daily change of beddings, no need to ask or request for. No other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new”
Reviews.Author: kenz188
Reviews.Content: this hotel is but its pretty good for a budget hotel. The staff at the counter are very courteous and willingly assisted us when we asked for guidance on how to get to our preferred destinations. Kudos guys especially the fellow who patiently educated us on how to reach sentossa via mrt. Its our first trip to singapore and this hotel completed the very nice experience. See you again in 3 yrs.

Reviews.Title: “rude front office staff. area has no nice restos to eat”
Reviews.Author: fufucruz
Reviews.Content: very rude filipina (phils) staff. argues with guest. wants immediate payment and you havent check in yet! too tiny hotel. very small.misserable hotel. elevator can fir only 3 people. you can sleep standing up, cant be for big people.water closet and hower all together in one teenie weeny room. rates are low but you get poor service, rude staff. not recommended for first timers in singapore.too crowded. size of room is like 2 x2 meters! no space for luggage to unload your clothes.will not recommend this hotel ever, forever, never again will come back to ANY frangrance hotel! If you want a headache go to this hotel. far from everything, far from taxi ride, mtr ride. budget hotel but you will spend more in transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: Gisrya
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my mother and two children for 3 nights. I requested to transfer to a bigger room because the 4 of us were literally packed liked sardines. The bathroom had mold on the ceiling. The reservations staff were very helpful and we were able to transfer the first night to the deluxe room. Deluxe room had 1 bed, 2 bathrooms and a sitting area - it was a big difference from our first room. The complementary breakfast was adequate. 2 eggs, toast and meat that looked like bacon but looked like a mystery meat. Overall we had a good stay and would recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: smitha135
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small, the shower is literally over the toilet. The location is very near the MRT and it took about 40 mins from the airport, but it was easy to find in the dark at close to midnight. Staff was very accomodating and helpful. AC did have some issues, but all in all for a nights sleep in Singapore I can't complain about less than 70 USD a night.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Noeville
Reviews.Content: We've been here for 3 nights. Reception staffs are accommodating and gave us tips were to exchange our money to get a better deal. Rooms are quite small. My mom and siblings stayed in a room at the 2nd floor and the AC was not working properly. Door to the balcony won't open. They don't have any views from their hotel room. My husband and I stayed in 7th floor and had a view of the main street in front of the hotel. Toilets are too small -- water all over when taking a shower and the area outside the toilet becomes wet too. Housekeeping not too good. Nothing to brag about their complimentary breakfast. We need to fall in line before 7am to get a table right away, otherwise, you will wait outside for the others to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room, awful plastic bed”
Reviews.Author: Alexharker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Jan 2012 Pros Location Friendly staff Good breakfast Fast Internet (ask to be put in a room with good internet) Cons Tiny room - we were in a superior, I think a standard room might actually be shoebox The mattress - it's made of plastic for easy wiping down. It's awful to sleep on, in fact we didn't sleep the first night as it was too uncomfortable. We paid 160 Sing Dollar - decide for your self if that is worth it for this average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights. The worst hotel I've ever stayed for the price”
Reviews.Author: waty_98
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for 7 nights. First day we arrived, lift didn't work, a staff had to go to 5th floor to check after wait 15 minutes it worked and we went to our room and we were disappointed and feel like moving to other hotel straihgt away. my husband is a western with 180cm tall, his leg sticking out from the bed because the size of bed very tiny. The bed cover with plastic which make your sleep uncomfortable because the sheet slipped all the time. The hallway is very narrow like 1,5m and no carpet, so all noise from outside you can hear, in the morning start 5am when everyone eary check out or go to breakfast, you will be awake. The toilet is very small, if you are shower, your partner can't go to sit on toilet other wise they will get all wet too. Breakfast in morning, you will face such a crowded people waiting in line, with those staff with no smile and not helpful at all. better go to breakfast room after 10am. I was amazed with the price I paid, . Oh btw, first day we enter the room, it so smelly, so humid and so many small creature like cockroach around, at least we have killed 5 of them during our 7 night stay. So, beside the location, everything else are poor. Sorry to say, but the owner of this hotel, have to try to sleep in this hotel to feel what we have experienced and they can improve the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are smaller than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: Empress1866
Reviews.Content: Likes -Location -Clean rooms & bathrooms -Swimming Pool -Bathroom amenities such as soap, toothbrush and toothpaste -Blower -Complimentary coffee making facilities inside the room -The people at the reception are nice especially the manager Dislikes -They have the rudest servers on earth! Would rather eat breakfast somewhere else. -Long queue at the their cafe every morning. -I'm petite but rooms are surprisingly small.

Reviews.Title: “the room is for is really small - fit for dwarfs only”
Reviews.Author: JFKtravel
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in has no window and the space is for small people, avoid this hotel where possible

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Koalakaye
Reviews.Content: We have just checked out of this hotel. It was in a terrific location only a few minutes walk to Little India MRT train stop (take a short cut down Mackenzie Street past the cinema) and if you are going to the Zoo or Night Safari they have a drop off spot at The Verge right near the hotel (I think they do pick-ups too but we didn't know about it until we got to the Zoo!). It only costs $23 to get to the airport from this hotel too. It's easy to walk through Little India and if you were feeling energetic you could walk to Raffles and the Colonial District. The rooms are cleaned every day and they include a TV, hair dryer and kettle. The air con is very good and they have a pool on the top floor. The rooms are however quite small. There is just enough room for a bed and a table/desk and a chair in the bedroom and a small bathroom which has the shower, toilet and sink in one small space. The room was plenty big enough for me and my husband for two nights. It is good value for Singapore where room prices are very expensive. The breakfast is pretty uninspiring - fried eggs and toast and sausage or bacon stuff or ham stuff or you can get the noodles. We got breakfast in Chinatown instead. Also they charge for the internet! Not good when most hotels we stayed in had it for free. Over all, I thought this hotel was clean and in an excellent location - I would stay here again if I came back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but everything else is bad”
Reviews.Author: Marco M
Reviews.Content: Smallest room I've ever slept it, I could barely put my baggage on the floor..no window in the room!!It was a jail..shower in the toilet without a cabin.. The air conditioned could not be turned off or the temperature changed, and I was freezing in Singapore with 35 degrees! Rude staff..I was waken up the first day by TWO people knocking on the door for 40 minutes because they wanted to clean the room..they wanted me to leave the room with my pajamas on for 10 mins to make her clean it..incredible..

Reviews.Title: “Compact and Bijou”
Reviews.Author: Howellsey
Reviews.Content: There is no denying that the rooms are small, tiny even, but they are clean, air conditioned, have all the facilities required and is in an excellent location. The breakfasts are odd but served with enthusiasm and politeness and were included in our room rate. The greatest surprise however was the rooftop pool which was clean and empty. The views across the city as the sunset and the bats came out was awesome and the kind of thing you'd expect to find somewhere far posher and more expensive than this place! I'd stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Quite good considering the price”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm_111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room at the Fragrance Hotel Selegie for 5 nights. Quite small though bathroom and room was considerably larger than some of the photos of twin rooms posted on the site. Room was clean and rooms are serviced daily. In a very good location close to Little India and the Mass Rapid Transit station which is a less than 5 minute walk away. When we arrived staff were quite accommodating allowing us to check-in at about 11:45am as opposed to the advertised 3pm time as we had arrived on an early flight. Breakfast is rather basic but edible. The rooftop pool is also a big plus. The only major problem I had with the place is the lack of free wifi, and the prices they charged for the use of the service were quite steep ($18 per day).

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel = Cannot Expect Much”
Reviews.Author: yukijunno
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I'm actually okay with the room size which is very tiny and spaceless. Technically, they provide you the basic things you looking in a hotel; 1) Clean bed and bedsheet 2) Clean room 3) Clean toilet Here is my long review; Pros: Walking distance 5mins to MRT Little India Walking distance 10-15mins to Bencoolen/Iluma/Bugis Junction/Bugis Street Walking distance 30mins to Orchard Road (sounds silly but we did walk) Walking distance 30-35mins to Suntec City Mall (didn't actually walk but we did walk till Grand Park City Hall Hotel about 20mins, so assuming 10-15mins walk more to reach Suntec City Mall from what we heard from our friends staying in Grand Park) Starbucks are just 500metre walk away on your right hand side after coming out from the Fragrance Selegie, it locates inside Selegie Complex) Check-in was okay, smooth, no waiting for long. (Check-in after 3PM, check-out before 12noon) Room was clean. Bed was not soft but sleep-able. (though I didn't sleep well on the first night) Bed sheet was clean but has holes. The air-cond works too well, with some water noises and 'whooosh' sounds. Bathroom was clean. Has water heater. Room lights works. Toilet did not smell fishy. Provides electronic water boiler. Provides hair dryer. Provides 2 hangers. Flat-screen TV with workable remote controller. Free luggage room where you can put your luggage in for FREE after you checked out. Cons: Room was small, it was hard to open my medium sized luggage. Broken mirror. You might hit or gang the wall while trying to move around or changing clothes. Small, very very small toilet. (you might wet the toilet paper if you are not careful enough and once you bath, you will wet the whole toilet/bathroom/washroom) Bed was short and small, if your height is more than 5'9, then your foot will exceed the bed's end. WIFI / Internet is chargable. (refer to my photos for the fees) Breakfast is terrible. One of the workers, I don't know their names but it was two of the aunties, very rude and very insensitive and very impatient. They thought we don't know how to speak English. I don't know, maybe they have hormone imbalance or something? Even the auntie outside the Old Chang Kee selling curry puff also behave the same. The wall/room is not soundproof, you can hear people talking/walking/pushing luggage/slamming doors/taking bath/hair drying in the night or middle of night. (yeap, seriously) Conclusion, I cannot say this hotel is BAD, but it certainly not GOOD either. Again, this is a budget hotel, you cannot expect much, if you want quality, good night sleep in a bigger hotel, I encourage you to find other hotel and pay more i.e. Ibis, Citadines, Landmark, Peninsular Orchard Hotel or Grand Park would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, clean, inc breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tracy S
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We only had an economy twin room.The rooms are small but quite comfortable. The shower/toilet and sink are together but that wasnt a problem. We just made sure we wiped the area down after we finished. You will need to take your own toiletries although there is a liquid soap dispenser on the wall, toothbrushes (no toothpaste) and a shower cap. The rooms are cleaned everyday, the complimentry water and coffee mix replaced daily( actually quite nice)> You can drink Singapore water, apparently it is quite safe. I used it for coffee - no probs. The staff at the hotel where very freindly and helpfull. The breakfast was simple- eggs, toast, hash brown and a choice of what i would lightly term, meat. The pool is lovely and cool. I wouldnt reccomend it for families or couples looking for a quite romantic time. It is a bit noisy. Its ok if you want a cheap place to stay for a short time. (max 5 nights) . The room service food was very nice, we just had a fried rice, but was lovely.The best thing about the hotel is its location. The train station is around the corner and the train system very easy to use. China town is 2 stops away. little India is down the street. Tip- go to china town first ( before little india) and wait till you get to the shops at the end before you start buying things. Most things are 3 for $10. We booked Universal studios with oneway transport from the hotel for the standard ticket price. The Sky way from sentosa is free when you are leaving. I still cant beleive how simple the train system was to use. 1 touch the screen to indicate destination. 2 pay fare( change given up to $4).3 a smart rider card is given for you to tag on and off the train. 4 at your destination, put your smart rider card back into the machine and you will get $1 refund.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean great location worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Stathos
Reviews.Content: Recommend it on low budget.Very close everything.Pool is great for swim.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: erryfp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one branch of Fragrance Hotel chains. The location is very good, near Little India, Bugis, and Orchard area. The closest MRT station is Little India, I think, only 5 mins walk across Tekka Market. Dhoby Ghaut MRT isn't too far also. Just 10 - 15 mins strolling down south to the crossroad of Prinsep Rd and Orchard Rd. Bus stop is in the front of the hotel. Taxis are plenty too. Right beside the hotel, there's 7-Eleven store and a local foodcourt. About the hotel itself, checkin was fast. I only needed to sign a confirmation letter (as the payment was already paid before). There's only one lift in the building to serve 10-storey building. But I rather disappointed with the room. It was so small there's barely floor space to move around and put luggage. The bathroom was also very minimalist. Only a square room consisted a wash basin, a toilet, and shower mounted on the wall. When I took a bath, floor quickly became wet and it took a long time to dry up. Nice thing about the room was the comfortable bed, cool air conditioning, wall-mounted TV, and an electric water boiler. You could boil some water to refill your drinking bottle as mineral water in Singapore is so expensive. Breakfast was quite good also. The capacity of the cafe (place for having breakfast) isn't too big, so you have to queue if the tables were fully occupied. After you got seated, you could choose one of three set of menus: 1) Sunny-side eggs served with hashbrown and choice of chicken ham/turkey bacon/chicken sausages; 2) Noodle soup with same choice of meat as 1); and 3) Cereals with mlik. All menus are accompanied by toasted bread, juice, & coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Bed-'n-Toilet”
Reviews.Author: mengrai
Reviews.Content: I guess I overestimated what one can get in Singapore for 138 Singapore dollars, or I underestimated prices versus quality here. This place, though in the heat of things, is no more than a short bed and a toilet around the corner. Though I'm short (1.70m) and I was alone, I had to lay a bit diagonally to prevent my feet from sticking out of the bed. The bathroom is even less to write home about, the shower is simply a shower head that will spray water against the wall when you close the door. Stand in between please. In the morning, many doors were slamming and people were talking loud through the narrow hallway that echoes. I checked a few more branches of the Fragrance hotel chain and what they seem to have in common is: very small rooms and this not so good smell coming out of the aircons when you enter the space. Singapore, see you again when my budget is not tight.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but strategic location to public transport”
Reviews.Author: Kinna084
Reviews.Content: Good:- This hotel is quite easy to find, exit Little India MRT A exit, 5 mins walk can arrive. Bus stop / taxi stop directly in front of hotel door. 7-11 convenience store next to hotel. The is a mall with Starbucks 10 minutes away. Local food available the hotel with 10 minutes walk. Fast in room Wi-Fi connection that is free (online booking promo) Cold air conditioner Friendly staff Bad:- Really small room, luggage have to be on the floor. There is only 1 lift. so meaning check in & check out time, dont expect to get into it that easy. Dirty bed sheets. Uncomfortable bed - very hard bed. Bad sound proof inside the room. Lack of food varieties for breakfast. Conclusion:- Its a budget hotel, so dont ask too much of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel with clean but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: miketri722
Reviews.Content: Located on the fringe of Little India, a short walk to the MRT station with a bus stop conveniently situated right outside the lobby, accessibilty is top notch. Service was good, everyone seemed trained to aim to please. The room is very small, I had a room with twin beds on the 9th floor and the bathroom is likewise tiny. You cant really complain because the rates here are so low compared to other hotels in SG, this being 2-star in my opinion. Those looking for bigger rooms should expect to pay upwards of US$130 (we paid US$100). This would be the perfect choice for those on a tight budget and yet prefer to be close to it all

Reviews.Title: “Had i good time”
Reviews.Author: kokoo82
Reviews.Content: First of all, the rooms are really small - you will have problems finding a spot to put your bag when you've squeezed your way in. Breakfast tastes nothing, but except from that, its quite good; nice pool on the roof, very clean and the staff are quite helpful. The area is good, you can walk to most places you'd like to go. There is only one stupid thing that annoyed me; You have to pay for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stacy020
Reviews.Content: The rooms are just too small. There is not even floorspace. It's that small! The bathroom is also pretty small, not much bigger than an airplane toilet. You use the toilet, brush your teeth and take a shower at exactly the same spot. There is only one elevator for the entire hotel. the location is kinda ok ..located near little india .. the staff are very unfriendly ...

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, short beds, airplane toilet”
Reviews.Author: Simen T
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small. There is not even floorspace to put your bag, you have to put it in on the bed. When you're going to sleep you have to get into bed, and then put the bag on the floor. When you wake up, you have to lift the bag onto the bed before you can put your feet on the floor. It's that small - really! The beds are probably built only for Asian people as they are no more than 1,8 meters long. The bathroom is also pretty small, not much bigger than an airplane toilet. You use the toilet, brush your teeth and take a shower at exactly the same spot. There is only one elevator for the entire hotel. Average waiting time is about 5 minutes on a regular afternoon - be prepared to use the stairs if in a rush. The wifi access cost 5 SGD for 2 hours - go to the Starbucks to blocks down for free wifi. (The swimmingpool at the roof is OK, but that's about it)

Reviews.Title: “Very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: TesyaJakarta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because I was transferred from the Parc Sovereign singapore, which I had book through Agoda. They missed my booking, and they said there were no rooms for me that night. Of course I was very disappointed with the Parc Sovereign hotel, and they transferred me to Fragrance Hotel Selegie which is only 3 minutes walking. When I came together with the staff of Parc Sovereign hotel, the staff in Fragrance Selegie knew my problem already. So they only ask my passport and directly send me to a single room located on the same floor as the lobby. The room is terribly small, with no windows. It has a tiny bathroom which the hot water was not working at the day of my stay. Despite of the tiny rooms, the staff of this hotel really amazed me as they are very helpfull. They showed empathy to my problem, and even they offered me to move to a double room. I refused their offer, it was only one night I thought. It was a blessing in disguise, being transferred to this hotel, giving experience for me to stay in this hotel. Beside the staff, the location is perfect. It is so close to Little India MRT, it has a bus stop right in front of the hotel, and a 7 eleven store is just nextdoor. I really like this hotel and yes I might say this hotel is very recommended for budget traveller:)

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel but narrow passges and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: singaporeJeddah
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights during my leisure travel to sin.hotel is neat and tidy staff are helpful easy access to shoping malls and city centre but rooms and toilet is very tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: brendalicious
Reviews.Content: The hotel has tiny rooms and the toilet as well and its so hard to shower because you cant move freely. However, the location is great, it's near to a number of food outlets where you can have a good meal. It's also a walking distance to Bugis, the biggest bargain shopping center in SG. On the way, there's also Sim Lim Square, an electronics shopping arcade where you can buy just about any gadgets. A word of advice: DON"T buy anything unless you need it and you really want to. Salesmen there can be very agressive and will not give us a chance to decline, dont know if they are all like that but just beware, otherwise you'll end up like me, bought an item that I don't really need .

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sarebear007
Reviews.Content: Ask yourself what you need your hotel for- if you are spending most of your holiday in it then this probably isn't the hotel for you, HOWEVER! If you are in Singapore to explore the sights sounds and wonders of this delightful city then this is a great place to stay.. It's close to Little India, Orchard Rd and if Clarke Quay and Chinatown if you're up for the walk, but you can also go to Dhoby Ghaut or Little India and catch the MRT to the last two if your feet are sore from shopping :) The reception will tell you otherwise but Dhoby Ghaut is the closer MRT station.. There is also a bus stop right outside the door! The rooms are small but you're only there to rest your feet, shower and store your luggage and SHOPPING! There is a tour desk at the reception who are helpful and there are money changers to the left of the hotel.. as well as a 24 hr food court.. Breakfast has 3 or 4 choices and it is quite nice, but if you get bored of the choices or it isn't for you then there are loads of options out and about for you and your travelling party :)

Reviews.Title: “compact and business like”
Reviews.Author: prabirjana
Reviews.Content: Although location of the hotel is fantastic, the rooms are too small for holiday traveller. The american breakfast is below ordinary, lacks variety and quality. The swimming pool is cool and refreshing. The bathroom is again too small. The airconditioning is very effective though. For business trip this hotel is still ok, but for holiday traveller..a strict no no. The rooms does not even have almirah for hanging the cloths!

Reviews.Title: “Small room but a nice location”
Reviews.Author: delijska10
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 days there on ourway to Bali. Location is really nice, walking distance to the center, too small rooms, but very clean. Wonderful swimming pool on the top ot the hotel. Frendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and conveniently located hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: sudharatnaparkhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fragrance Hotel-Selegie, Singapore for two days this year in June when I visited Singapore with my husband. My husband had booked this hotel online because of its locational advantage as it was on Selegie Road which extended to Serangoon Road, the hub for Indian tourists. The staff at the front desk and travel desk were very courteous and helpful. The food provided in the Hotel restaurant was good too. Cleanliness appreciable. Size of the room and toilet was too small and beyond imagination. We could not even open our suitcase on the floor and had to lift it onto the bed to open. There was no wardrobe in the room. Just a coat hanger was provided on a hook. The shower was over the toilet and if you showered then the toilet was wet for the rest of the day. Yes the room is small but I don't go on holidays to sit in a hotel room. As long as there is a bed, a shower and a toilet and the price is reasonable, I'm happy. We had travelled to Singapore from Kuala Lumpur by executive bus which had reasonable fare and took just 5 hours (including the time spent at Immigration and Customs). The bus which left Kuala Lumpur at 11 in the night reached Singapore at 3.55 AM sharp next morning. Since the hotel booking was from 3 PM, we had put our luggage in the Hotel’s cloak room, freshened up in the hotel and we went to Mustafa, which is open 24 hours. After that we went for the Sentosa tour and returned by 2 PM. Close to the hotel was Anand Bhavan chain of hotel which provided delicious Indian vegetarian meals. We then had the city tour later. The travel desk in the hotel arranged our visits to Sentosa, City Tour, Night Safari and the hotel is the pick up point too. Close to hotel are Mustafa Shopping Mall and Orchard Road where you can get anything you desire for your home, a souvenir for your friends, etc. You will find the staff at the front desk of the hotel very helpful and courteous. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Sudha Ratnaparkhi

Reviews.Title: “"horrible Nightmare"”
Reviews.Author: purab
Reviews.Content: the service was horribly pathetic and the room was like a small cabin, which cannot be called a room if you see it, location was fine, however the amenities were all exaggerated with limited same breakfast, me being a vegetarian with limited quantity, as also if you call for a siple thing like SUGAR, they said they do not provide it...which was RIDICULOUS. Dont advise any one to stay even if its for FREE , .....Horribly Pathetic , as the Front Office Staff also did not have any courtesy nor were they ready to guide... Not Suitable for any kind of traveler...At your own risk..!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room Ever!”
Reviews.Author: pimpmycribs
Reviews.Content: I liked reception Ladies, they are very all very nice. But maid service is not very good. Bedding was wired. Bathroom sucks, just look at the pictures we took of the room. it is super small and little scary. I guess it is what you pay for in Singapore. I think you can get a lot better place if you pay $30 more. Free Breakfast is ok, but you can go have yummy breakfast so cheep at the market near hotel. My favorite was Little India Tikka Wet Market. (5 minutes walk) Hotel location is pretty awesome. You are right by Little india and Night Market Buggis Street.

Reviews.Title: “A compact room - with the positives of it being clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: VivzHolidays1
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Singapore with three other friends. We booked two separate rooms. A double bed room for each. The room is very compact. It was impressive that a double bed and a desk could fit in the small room. It was surprising. There wasn't much room for our two suitcases - our luggage was big enough to contain 20kgs. So, depending on your luggage measurements - you might find it difficult making room for two suitcases of that size. The bathroom is extremely small. So small... that you could sit on the toilet and shower at the same time. Make sure to put away your toilet paper before showering. Otherwise you'll need ask the receptionist for more. The bed's sheets are VERY THIN. It felt like there was nothing on you. I prefer some weight when it comes to my sheets. Thats my personal preference, therefore I was very disappointed with the bed covers. The breakfast isn't something you'd be excited about in the morning. It was pale and unfulfilling. Best to take advantage of Singapore's awesome food by going out to eat. The service was good. A friend and I had a trouble with a stalker from the front of the hotel. He followed us into the hotel's lobby. But, we informed the receptionist of the situation. They immediately took charge of the situation. Told the man to leave. They called the police. Then they escorted us to a waiting taxi at the back of the hotel. I give thumbs up for their action. Overall, the location is very good. The hotel is close to many tourist locations. I guess you pay for what you buy. It is a budget hotel. But, it is clean with a good location. If you have the mentality of a room being a place to sleep and you don't mind it being small - then you'll enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean”
Reviews.Author: SteenN
Reviews.Content: the hotel is fine for the price, very small room, but i think it is normal singapore standard, and you only stay there for sleep anyway. wc/bathroom very very small. glad i stayed there on my own :-)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pratnaparkhi
Reviews.Content: Fragrance Hotel – Selegie, Singapore (01 – 02 June 2010) Conveniently located hotel We stayed at Fragrance Hotel-Selegie, Singapore for two days from the early morning of 1 June to late night of 2 June 2010. I had booked this hotel online because I found the location of the Hotel to be very convenient as it was on Selegie Road which extends to Serangoon Road, the hub for Indian tourists. The staff at the front desk and travel desk were very courteous and helpful. The food provided in the Hotel restaurant was good too. Cleanliness appreciable. Size of the room and toilet was too small and beyond imagination. I could not even open my suitcase on the floor and had to lift it onto the bed to open. There was no wardrobe in the room. Just a coat hanger was provided on a hook. The shower was over the toilet and if you showered then the toilet was wet for the rest of the day. Yes the room is small but I don't go on holidays to sit in a hotel room. As long as there is a bed, a shower and a toilet and the price is reasonable, I'm happy. We had travelled to Singapore from Kuala Lumpur by executive bus which had reasonable fare and took just 5 hours (including the time spent at Immigration and Customs). The bus which left Kuala Lumpur at 11 in the night reached Singapore at 3.55 AM sharp next morning. Since the hotel booking was from 3 PM, I had put my luggage in the Hotel’s cloak room, freshened up in the hotel and we went to Mustafa, which is open 24 hours. After that we went for the Sentosa tour and returned at 2 PM. Close to the hotel is Anand Bhavan chain of hotel which provided delicious Indian vegetarian meals. We had the city tour later. The travel desk in the hotel can arrange your visits to Sentosa, City Tour, Night Safari and the hotel is the pick up point too. Close to hotel are Mustafa Shopping Mall and Orchard Road where you can get anything you desire for your home, a souvenir for your friends, etc. You will find the staff at the front desk of the hotel very helpful and courteous. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Pradeep Kumar

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: We checked in ...saw the room....left our luggage and went to Singapore tourist bureau in orchard st and booked us Holiday Inn at 180SGD and moved out that same night. Why? You can't imagine how small the room is and on top of that no windows at all...like a basement floor. I think if you come from the western world, you will be very shocked. Bathroom is not what you expect. Pay more and enjoy Singapore...its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Small no-frills hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: azulle01
Reviews.Content: Don't come here expecting outstanding amenities, but this is a great choice of hotel for its location, and if you are not going to be in your room much of the time anyway. For us it was pretty much just a place to sleep, bathe, have breakfast and leave our things because we were busy sight-seeing the rest of the time. There are many places of interest nearby like Little India (LOVED the 24-hour Mustafa Shopping Centre!), and MRT stations at walking distance. The room is itsy-bitsy at 3 x 3 meters and the bathroom, 1.5 x 1 meters. There was just enough space in the room for a bed, a small dresser and a chair. The telephone and TV are mounted on the wall. In the bathroom, everything is right there with the showerhead also attached to the wall so the toilet would be wet after showering, but there was strong water pressure and it didn't take long for water to heat. For such a tiny room, they still had amenities like complimentary coffee, electric teapot, shower caps and a few other items, and a body-wash dispenser in the bathroom. Despite its small size it was a comfortable-enough room, except that the walls were thin and anyone passing by outside could be heard, including wheeled luggage clicking/rolling away on the tile floor. The room was always very clean. Staff service was not consistent, some of the Front Desk staff being extremely helpful with our touristy inquiries, and others being a little bit clipped in their responses. I appreciated that the Front Desk staff informed me there was an international payphone a few steps outside the hotel where I could make calls for 1/4 the rate that it would cost if calling from inside the room. The staff at breakfast were always very nice with prompt service. Breakfast is also not amazing but it was filling for someone of my appetite, at least it wasn't just pieces of toast with jam. There was the toast, with two eggs (or you could choose noodles instead of the toast and eggs), and one of your choice of three breakfast meats (turkey ham, chicken sausage, and I forgot the other one). It was helpful that there was a tour desk (tour operator was called RMG) from 9 AM to 6 PM everyday and there were plenty of brochures in the lobby to help us maximize our sightseeing, which we needed because it was our first time in Singapore. Side note - be careful which tour packages you take. Some of them are very good value for money (we took the Sentosa afternoon tour) and others are a bit of a rip-off; we got suckered into the Night Safari, which as it turned out would have been much cheaper to go on our own AND we got left behind by the bus home even though we were at the meeting place on time. Rack rates are about S$200 a night but we got our 4-night stay on a very cheap promotional rate. I probably would not be as happy about my stay if we had paid full price, but we left the Fragrance Selegie satisfied enough for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fragrance Hotel - Selegie suited us just fine!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina392009
Reviews.Content: Our aim was to find a well-priced hotel that was close to the MRT and walking distance to many attractions. We did our research on-line and booked this hotel the same way. Reading through other comments we were aware that the rooms might be small. We weren't surprised to find that the rooms were tiny when we got there. We didn't mind since we were out all day and basically needed the room to bathe and sleep. We asked for a room with a view and we got it!. The staff at front desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was kept very clean. The swimming pool was just wonderful after coming home from a tiring day on the go!!!The breakfast isn't filling but the portion is enough to get you through to lunch. One negative comment would be the size of the breakfast room. When we had to eat early (7.15am) to be ready for an 8am departure to Malaysia, we found that seats were minded by patrons for their friends. We complained at reception and got immediate attention and seats for breakfast that morning. Overall, I would give Fragrance Hotel - Selegie a 4 out of 5. The one mark was lost due to the small room. I would stay there again and do not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any couple that wants to discover Singapore. Thank you, Tina xx

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: sparkly_shoes
Reviews.Content: Plus points... Breakfast included in rate – choice of approx 9 set meals with tea/coffee. Fry (hash browns/eggs/chicken ham) or noodle dish or continental breakfast (cereal). Not plentiful or large portions but satisfactory. Lovely rooftop pool open until 10pm Not so good.... We booked a double room and got accommodated in a twin room. Room had no window and was very fusty. Very poor light in room – impossible to read on one of the beds. TV was very small and difficult to see from beds - DVD player did not work. Location – didn’t seem to be much around hotel easily accessible on foot – could not find the nearby MRT station (though didn’t spend much time looking, just got a taxi) No safe in room. Room was not always clean – on many occasions there were numerous ants in both the room and bathroom. I do not like the shower over the toilet - basically everything in the tiny bathroom gets wet!

Reviews.Title: “Insanely poor service, you will not sleep well here; find other value hotels.”
Reviews.Author: djdroogie
Reviews.Content: Service: -The staff advised me to book online to get a certain rate. After I did (in their business center), the front desk told me they could not confirm the booking b/c their business office was closed (6 p.m.) and asked me to pay a cash deposit or charge my MasterCard. After I refused, the front desk asked me to print out my reservation (FOR A FEE) from the computer. I also refused to pay this fee since I was not told about the office closed complication. Finally they printed out my reservation from my e-mail account. The front desk did not apologize for the inconvenience. The check in process took 30 minutes. -After check in, the front desk checked us into the wrong room w/ one bed after I specifically asked for the exact same type of room (two beds) from the night before. **The front desk did not apologize for their error.** -The following morning, after I requested a 1 p.m. check out b/c we went to sleep at 6 a.m., we were called no less than THREE times starting at 11 a.m. in the morning, advising us to check out at 12 p.m. Imagine the frustration when you are running on very little sleep and the front desk is constantly hassling you to check out before the agreed upon time (also put in writing on check in). Again, we were called THREE times in the same morning after telling the front desk we needed a late check out. Room: -The room is small, but for the price, there is no reason to complain about the size. I am curious how big the rooms are at a similarly priced hotel/chain such as Hotel 81 (adjacent to Fragrance Selegie). -Expect to be woken up by your neighbors in the morning due to thin doors and many rooms next to each other and narrow halls. Recommend ear plugs and unplugging phone for good night sleep. -Expect the sun to wake you up through the curtains. -Wi-Fi is available in the room but you must pay to use it. The business center is $1 SGD for 15 minutes. Location: -The location is in Little India. There are many excellent, affordable restaurants within walking distance, especially if you are vegetarian. This was a big plus for our stay. -It is very difficult to get a taxi outside of the hotel b/c the taxis do not want to stop at the bus stop outside of the hotel. You have to walk a few blocks away to hail a taxi. There is a reservation fee for the front desk to fetch you a taxi. -There are shopping centers within walking distance and the main subway hub is about a 5-10 minute walk away. Amenities: -Rooftop pool is a big plus. You can use this pool even AFTER you check out. The adjacent toilet has a shower so you can wash up before you catch your evening flight or what have you. -The cafe services included breakfast up to 11 a.m. This is great if you need to sleep in and still want to eat a light breakfast. -The cafe does not allow outside food which I find ridiculous. You pay a hotel for a home away from home and you should be able to eat outside of an EXTREMELY tiny room which is uncomfortable to eat in. Miscellaneous -There is no storage closet/locker for bags, although you can leave your bags in the lobby after check out which I do not recommend if you need any level of security. Conclusion -I do not recommend this hotel, check out Hotel 81 next door (or other value hotels) as a possible alternative (although I did not stay at Hotel 81). -If you MUST stay here, go to sleep with the phone unplugged and with ear plugs in and eye mask, and book your reservation at least 24 hours in advance (print out your reservation if possible).

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: EdithEdith
Reviews.Content: negative: very small room, toilet=shower (hence whole bath room wet after shower), we were downgraded i/o upgraded, TV was broken in our room, air condition was very loud, breakfast was very basic and not charming at all positive: swimming pool, 5 min to next subway station (Little India)

Reviews.Title: “Bad HOTEL.. Feels like on hell”
Reviews.Author: kakek_ganas
Reviews.Content: The only best thing that i found is the breakfast... The staff can give you a very warm welcome.... They served you like you r an artist.... But the rest.... was so awful. The receptionist huh ... was not hospital at all The room very small..... Bad hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Little India SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: amittuteja
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a roof-top swimming pool. Located within walking distance of Singapore's culturally-rich and commercially-vibrant areas like Little India and Bugis Village. Mustafa and Kopitiam (Snack Store) are also nearby. Staff was very polite and helpful. But the rooms and bathroom are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: docgrace2002
Reviews.Content: we really had a very bad experience to this hotel, we arrived there almost 5 in the afternoon and were all tired due to long travel,we are very much confident that they have a room reserved for us bec. we booked via online, they send us a confirmation letter that our reservation is confirmed, but then when we got there, the attending receptionist who is also a filipina told us that our reservation has been cancelled for no reason and all of their rooms are occupied. they caused us a lot of disappointments, they transfer us to another hotel without any free transportation, its all in our expense. i dont recommend this hotel to all of my friends. i really hate this hotel, dont book here.

Reviews.Title: “Fragrance Selgie, Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: ankils
Reviews.Content: We should have read the reviews before booking. The hotel has deteriorated since earlier reviews were written. Our room, which was very small, had the most compact bathroom we have ever seen. The walls were dirty and mouldy. The bedding was clean and comfortable and the shower heat and pressure was great - if you don't mind straddling the toilet while showering. A bath mat (not supplied) is needed due to water all over bathroom after shower. There is a cool pool at the hotel (no towels) which is desirable at the end of a hot day. The pool is starting to show age and needs more cleaning. Location of hotel is quite central and close to many shops and restaurants in the Little India district.

Reviews.Title: “Good value although rooms are extremely tiny”
Reviews.Author: dankoliver
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are extremely tiny and very noisy. I stayed there two nights with my wife and we had very small luggage but even that was somehow difficult to get into the room since there are no closets and on the floor is no space either - just a small path to the bathroom. When we stayed there in 03/2010 there was some renovation work going on and the fresh rooms where looking much better than before the renovation. Try to get a room in the upper floors and as far away from the elevator as possible - there the noise is not so bad. Over all I recommend this hotel - the location is quite good (only 200 meters from Little India subway station) and it's one of the few decent places which are not in the red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, otherwise a substandard hotel offering poor value”
Reviews.Author: CelestiaWales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, close to Little India and its cheap restaurants, as well as being near to the centre of Singapore. I stayed for one night to sample the local Indian cuisine following a business trip. My room was basically a small box and the shower and toilet were in the same place, with the effect that the toilet gets covered in water when taking a shower. All the airconditioning units for the complete third floor were outside my window, with the effect that my room was noisy all night long. In my opinion, the hotel offers poor value

Reviews.Title: “Yikes. This one was a surprise/nightmare”
Reviews.Author: SquareWorld
Reviews.Content: Due to the lack of hotel rooms in town, our agent booked us into the Fragrance which looked fairly close to the Conrad Centennial. The price was cheap(er) at about 66 USD per night. Nice when compared to the Conrad at 350 USD (sold out anyway). With my business partner we arrived at 130am and checked in. Very courteous front desk staff. We thought we arrived at one of those 'japanese business' hotels which are compact yet efficient. We were wrong. Our room size was 8 feet by 10 feet (including the bathroom). Imagine this with two small single sized beds. My tall partner and I had to take turns opening our luggage, had to fight for the 2 hangers hanging on the 3 knobbed clothes rack on the wall, fight over the two cups of complimentary water, oh, and fight for who got to shower first being that the shower nozzle poking out of the bathroom wall (no stall mind you) would soak everything from the toilet to the paper dispenser in the 4 foot by 4 foot bathroom. Oh, and don't leave your suitcase lying down in front of the bathroom door either, the water from the shower splashes under the door. Per square foot, you're paying $0.82 per square foot here, at the Conrad it's $0.54. Hard to catch a taxi too, as not many pass by the street and you have to walk a ways because they are not allowed to stop at bus stops (one right in front of hotel). Although the staff was nice, it's not the best for business travelers. Definitely not a value for money when the comfort level is so low.

Reviews.Title: “optimal choice”
Reviews.Author: SandraandLukasz
Reviews.Content: cheap but had everything you need close to most of the things tiny rooms but you just need it for sleep so doesn't matter everyday fresh drinking water, clean towels and other useful things the most important thing - air-con :) breakfast every morning (included in their low prices) pool on the roof

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: redcat2 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. The room was very small but was adequate and the hotel was very handy for shops and transport. The swimming pool was a bonus and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: shyshine_183
Reviews.Content: The Hotel looks small when seen from outside. But once inside, the hotel and the rooms were tidy and spacious. - The hotel is on the main road, the bus stop is just out side the hotel. - the subway is about 200mts from the hotel. the trains are always on time.. make sure u carry a subway map. - they have sight seeing tours scheduled everyday, a mini bus picks you from the hotel and then drops you back in the evening. - there food served in the restaurant is good and the place is clean. Only problem was the breakfast menu was mostly the same through out. there are many eateries lined near the hotel. - there are may shopping centers a stone throw from the hotel. Mustafa center is also close by. The staff at the hotel behaved nicely and suggested places and 'must do things' at singapore. Overall the 5 day stay was good and most important travel and shopping centers were very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice & clean but very small room”
Reviews.Author: filipinaLady
Reviews.Content: me and my 2teenage kids arrived in singapore after our trip in kuala lumpur. since it was holiday peak season the hotel rates are really expensive. fragrance selegie have good location ,very near to little india mrt station. the room is very small, but clean. they have 2beds but have no space for lugages (advisable for back packers only) the shower is very small ,everything get wet so no need to bring your clothes inside the bathroom while taking shower hahaha.they have modern LCD tv with built in dvd player for your convenience. have swimming pool upstairs. the plated set breakfast of 2pcs toasted bread, ham and egg and a choice of hot tea or coffee is enough for light breakfast atleast :) i would recommend this to budget travellers like me

Reviews.Title: “Very Tiny Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshReview
Reviews.Content: Clean but tiny Rooms. They are really Tiny rooms. Book thru internet as the rates accross the desk are higher. The best thing about this hotel is, it is near little India station so you can commute to anywhere thru MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Good Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: whitesun
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms way in advance and our inquiries were promptly answered via e-mail and chat (available at the hotel website). The hotel is very accessible, about 3-5 mins walk from the Little India train station and there's a bus stop right in front of the hotel entrance. It's also near Sim Lim Square (about 2 blocks away), a must-visit if you're into electronic gadgets. The reception staff are very accommodating and prompt; they even let us check-in early at no extra cost (early check-in has a charge, according to the website) and checking in was a breeze. The rooms are really tiny, with just enough space for the bed, a dresser and a chair and no space for our bags; the bathroom's even tinier . The other reviewers have it right that once you open the shower, you splash water all over the bathroom. That's how small it is. Our room has a t.v. that showed mostly non-English channels, but upon closer inspection, it has a built-in DVD player so we mostly watched DVDs at night during our stay there. Breakfast does the job, nothing to write home about but it's enough to get you going. The small rooftop pool IS a nice touch though. For all its faults, I didn't mind staying at the Fragrance Selegie due to its affordable rate, accessibility and basic comforts. If you just need a bed for the night, I would recommend Fragrance Selegie.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: tumbuna
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were very small but functional. The recption staff are very upfront about this when checking in. The pool on the roof is a nice touch. The shower is tiny and will get everything wet so keep clothes outside the bathroom. Breakfast is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samantharatnayake
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and on arrival the service was swift and efficient. Our room was clean and all you can ask of a room in this price range, the bathroom is small, but who cares! All the staf were polite and keen to help.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget & location, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: ausooi
Reviews.Content: Do take note that this was a last minute booking, and took a punt on this one base on the ratings on asiarooms. Stayed for couple of nights. Negatives: Room is small. Have since stayed in another budget (Value Thompson), and this one is smaller. Shower will get everything wet. The room also didn't have much place to put lugguage, tv was like 15" (the other had like 32") :) Worst of all. Paper-thin walls. Couldn't sleep as people was walking and talking in hallways most of the night. To their credit the staff did assist when I asked them to help. Positives: Location was not bad, near little india and lots of local food and convenient shops as well. Overall: While my experience was a bad, I am sure others can select this place if there is lack of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eryepe
Reviews.Content: It really clean hotel, but the space is very small for me.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean... and you gotta love your eggs and toast!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug502
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore and we were doing it on budget - this hotel suited our needs. The room was quite tiny compared to other places we stayed at but did have its own bathroom, which worked perfectly. There was a dresser table with hair dryer and complimentary snacks, which didn't really tickle our fancy but at least they were offered. The bed wasn't that fantastic; it was a bit plastic and made funny noises when you rolled around but if your a fan of beds that need a bit of a tougher mattress for back support, this is the kind of place to stay. The staff were great and really friendly - they helped us out with directions and finding locations which was really nice. Our room was serviced daily and efficiently so it was always clean. The staff are pretty young but very reliable and professional - no problems of communication at all. The breakfast menu is limited, but complimentary with your room booking. It is optional - don't have to eat it and if you do, might get sick of eggs and ham by the end of your trip but the offer is there! The location is quite convenient - located in Little India, it was only about a 5-10 minute walk to Little India station which then you could connect to other stations via the Singapore MTR. It was also about a 15 minute walk away from Bugis and Bugis Village, key hotspots in Singapore. Overall, stay was great and we liked it - highly recommend it for any travellers with a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeandKe
Reviews.Content: Good location - near Little India. The way from the airport cost 18 SGD. Rooms are small, but clean. Breakfast ok - they are doing eggs. We were for 3 nights there, so it was no problem for us to have the smaller choice from the breakfast menu. Pool is on the roof - good. I recommend this hotel for short staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: KMABD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in a family room from 14th to 17th July 2009. Everything about this hotel is just fine except that the rooms are too small. Beds are of standard size but you will find it difficult to lay flat your bigger luggage on the floor within the space adjacent to your bed. Fortunately we had only airline cabin luggage (hand carry) which were small enough to lay flat on the floor. Other than this, everythings else is fine. The hotel, especially the toilet, was clean and hygenic. Rooms are free from any odors and are with windows. The swimming pool on the roof had clean water. The American set breakfast was very good indeed. The nearest subway "Little India" is less than five minutes walk from the hotel. Local bus stops right in front of the hotel. The surrounding city environment is just fine with a number of shops and stores on the Selegie road. The Singapore shopping district Orchard Road is about ten to fifteen minutes walk. The hotel staff were very helpful, cooperative and courteous. I short, it is a very good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Jigsaw puzzle in the room”
Reviews.Author: esskayw115
Reviews.Content: An efficient set-up, however the rooms were so tiny that you had to settle in yourself and your luggage as in a Jigsaw puzzle. Staff was cooperative and breakfast was just OK. Hotel is stingy with things like early check-in and late check-out with extra charges for both. Perhaps alright for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its TINY! get the message? - TINY!!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Surjo1975
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Fragrance Selegie for 1-night only on 3rd April 09, and I MUST admit at the very onset....I have Never Ever seen such a small hotel room!! We were on our way to Bali for a short holiday, and had to stay a night in Singapore, to catch an early-morning 6:20am flight out. After checking out the hotel-group's website and reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor, we zeroed in on the Fragrance Selegie. Sure, every reviewer had mentioned the small size of the room - but I guess nothing had quite prepared us for just How small it actually is.... I mean, its TINY !!!! So... anyone reading this review, get this into your minds guys! - the room is TINY! the beds are TINY! (if you are 6feet tall and well-built, you won't fit. if you are in the habit of rolling over in your sleep, you WILL fall off - but only on one side, the other side of the bed is bang against the wall). The loo is TINIER still! There is no cupboard, only a few hooks for the clothes-hangers. There is No place to really open up your suitcase and leave it that way - you need to take out whatever you need, and then leave it upright (unless you intend to jump over it!). Overall it is spotlessly clean, the AC works well, the room has all the basic amenities in terms of TV, electric kettle, mineral water and even a chair! LOL! You may feel that such a cramped room is really not worth paying 99 Sing-dollars for... however, what you cannot find fault with is the location. This place is located just 5 minutes walk away from Little India with its myriad offerings and interests, and about 10minutes walk in the opposite direction from Orchard Rd. There is a tube-station nearby. Taxis are easily available at all times of the day and night. (We were a bit worried initially whether we would find a cab easily at 4am and thought of pre-booking a cab, but the hotel staff assured us there was no need to do that and pay the extra booking-fee). Can't really comment on any of the other amenities, or the complimentary breakfast that's part of the room-rate. We had checked in at 9pm and checked out at 4am, so skipped the breakfast. To sum up, if you are looking for a nice spacious well-located holiday hotel to laze around in, this place is not what you're looking for!... however, like us, if you are merely looking for a place to crash for one night (maybe two!) then consider this hotel for its great location. Ideal for : singles, couples on a budget. Not suited for : young parents with one little kid, families.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: swedishtravellers
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The location was perfect with walking distance to the Orchard Road. And the price we paid was very cheap if you compare with other hotels in central Singapore. The room was quite small but very modern and clean with a flat TV with DVD. The bathroom was also very small but clean and modern. What can you expect for that money? We can really recommend this hotel, if you are not planning to spend so much time in the hotel room as they were quite small. If you are going on a holiday for several nights then I would maybe choose another hotel. We just spent one night there so we did not mind at all.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: kc_italy
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good and close to little india and to the underground station. Easy to find. Good service and price, especially when you book on line (if you book at the hotel the price is a lot higher). NOTE! THE ROOMS ARE EXTREMELY SMALL, so are the beds, so if you are tall you might have some problems. The toilet is tiny!! Still all rooms are fully equipped: biscuits, toothbrush, shampoo, cups, coffee & kettle. Breakfast is ok. There's a little swimmingpool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned! The rooms are SMALL!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleAnnabelle
Reviews.Content: Before we went to Singapore, we read about how small the rooms were going to be, but you will really not be able to believe it until you actually see it! My partner and I are only about 165cm in height, but our feet reached the bottom of the bed, so if you are any taller than this, your feet will possibly hang over the edge! If you put your suitcase lying down, you will take up a lot of room on the floor. You will have to step over the luggage to get around the bed. The bathroom is super tiny as well. I thought the other reviews were exaggerating when they said that you could go to the toilet and have a shower at the same time, but its true! Although the room is small, it is VERY clean and if you just want to use the hotel for sleeping, then it serves its purpose very well. The bathroom has a soap dispenser for showers, so there is no need to bring your own body soap. They also provide you with plastic sealed cups of water daily, as well as crackers, and a tissue box. The pool is nice and clean and when we used it, there weren't many other people (or anyone for that matter). The hotel charges you if you want an extra towel for swimming though. Breakfast is simple to kick start your day. We stayed there 6 nights and had complimentary breakfast there every morning. Each person gets 2 eggs (sunny side up or well done), 2 pieces of toast and jam, a hash brown, a piece of lettuce and a piece of tomato, and coffee and juice. I didn't get sick of it, but my friends did. The location is superb. It is located thin 10 minutes walk to Bugis Markets, 5 minutes walk to Little India and Little India MRT which takes you everywhere and 15 minutes walk to Orchard Rd. There is also a cheap food court about 5 minutes away! The 7/11 next door provides you with snacks and drinks when you need it! I would definitely recommended this hotel if you just want a nice, clean place to sleep in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “OK for me & friends..!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Lady79
Reviews.Content: I've expected the room is so tiny. So it doesn't matter for me & my friends. We stayed in family rooms with one queen bed & one single bed. For us, we spend more time outside. The room is only to rest & sleep at night. The hotel location is good. Only about 5-8 minutes walk to Little India MRT Station. The room & bathroom was clean. Nothing bad to say about the hotel. It's a good 2 1/2 star hotel. But you have to accept that the room is TINY!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny with Good Location (Malaysia)”
Reviews.Author: AoraKuching
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by a travel agent because I wanted a cheaper hotel in a strategic location. I did read about how tiny the rooms are but I thought hey, it cannot be that bad. We arrived in Singapore on Friday and were put in a double room. Like the other reviews, I was really suprised to see that the room is the tiniest room that I have ever seen. As my booking was a twin room, I went to the front desk to ask for a change. They quickly obliged and that was a relief. For breakfast, we had American Breakfast for 4 days straight as our stay was for 5 days. As Asian, I guess my taste is more for Asian cuisine though I did not mind the American Breakfast. The location of the hotel is very strategic despite the tiny room we were put into. Little India is just a stone throw, Orchard Rd is just a few minutes walk form the hotel and there are plenty of food stalls and restaurants in the area in case you go hungry. For a quick bite, you can go to 7-eleven that is located next to the hotel. They have a variety of sandwiches up for grab. Going around is also easy. At the lobby, there is a travel agent desk ready to take you around to interesting places in Singapore. The service provided was good and the guides are well-trained. There is a public bus right in front of the hotel and we tried getting on that one too. It cost us a dollar each to get to the hotel from the Singapore Flyer. Overall, our visit to Singapore was a really good one. We managed to see what we wanted to see and experienced the best of Singapore. Well the hotel is just a place to rest after a long outing. Just close an eye to the size of the room and ENJOY SINGAPORE.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint-hearted.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwijock
Reviews.Content: There was no room on the floor to open suitcases, or to store them flat. The shower was literally over the toilet because the "bathroom" was so small. The rooms upstairs were clean and quiet, but we had horror stories from other guests about conditions lower down - holes in doors and so much noise all night that sleep was impossible. Breakfast was an experience to be missed. We were told by taxi drivers that this a leading "love hotel" where rooms are let for short term assignations. Taxis are not allowed to stop outside during the day as there is a bus stop there, so beware if it is raining.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but really really small”
Reviews.Author: BlueHeeler777
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad for around $55 AUD which is incredibly cheap for Singapore. But if you have large suitcases... beware as there is nowhere to store them. There were two double beds and two bathrooms in basically what was one room--just enough room for the beds. There is a small rooftop pool, and breakfast was included. It is very reasonable for the price as long as you are not expecting a resort style stay. As we were out most of the day it met our needs as we used it only for sleeping. We found the staff to be very reasonable. The only issue we had was a room full of drunks on our floor at about 2.00am. I suppose this is to be expected in a cheap hotel. I rang down to the reception but no action was taken, so I went out myself and told them to be quiet. Great value and I would stay there again if only staying a couple of days. If holidaying or wanting more of a leisurely type stay, I would stay in a resort style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest rooms I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: shirin
Reviews.Content: When we booked this Hotel, we had already read reviews saying that the rooms were really small. However, we could not have imagined HOW really tiny they were ! There were three of us ( my husband, adult daughter and myself ) in a so-called FAMILY ROOM, which literally did not have space to put a suitcase flat on the floor -- we had to put them on the beds whenever we needed to open them. There was not a single shelf or cupboard -- and just enough room to walk around the 3 beds !! The bathroom was about 3' x 3' big -- but I must say that it somehow fitted in a toilet, shower and basin -- and there was plenty of hot water. My main gripe, however, is that we were travelling with my other daughter and her small and fretful baby -- and the management kept us sitting in the lobby for FOUR HOURS and would not allow us to check in even a little earlier than the fixed time !! To be fair -- the rooms and baths were sparkling clean, and when the AC conked out late one night, we were immediately moved to another ( equally tiny !) room. And the hotel was very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Vincesmith_UK
Reviews.Content: This is the most disgusting place I have ever come across Rooms, or should I say boxes 3 meter sq max First room I was offered had no windows bathroon as wide as a hand washbasin abd you can literally sit on the toiet and take a shower at the same times I had a so called superior room I shidder to think what a standard room was like Breakfast frugal and cold Avoid it at all costs One word diescribes it for jne and that is disgusting and a total con

Reviews.Title: “Small room But still ggod”
Reviews.Author: jaedyn6
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was good. rooms are small but clean. Bathroom is small(you can sit on the toilet and wash your hair at the same time).
