No joking. breakfast was goo and the cafe has a great menu for lunch and dinner options. 5 mins to mrt Great location Would stay again great pool too

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi2222
Reviews.Content: I don't like to be a negative person, but I have to say this and warn others about this 'hotel'. The rooms are far far far too small. Our room had NO window and could only fit a small double bed in it, with no room to place our bags or walk around the bed. It felt like a prison cell. The bed was basically a hard foam slab - and it has a vinyl cover over it. It was extremely uncomfortable and we had two nights of horrible sleep. The room was exceptionally noisy with the sound of water flushing around. The corridors are very noisy and the cleaners kept insisting on shouting and dragging equipment around at 10-11pm. Why so late? On the positive side, the location of the property is excellent, is very clean and tidy, the staff are very friendly and oblivious to their guests pain. The combined TV/DVD player is a nice touch - but only if you've got DVD's to play. The range of TV channels is like 5 channels, mostly in asian languages and with terrible reception. We booked on Wotif and paid SGP$171 per night for a 'superior room' which was cheaper than the rack rate. For this price, this property has no right to call itself a Hotel. The room size will leave you feeling ripped off, tired and grumpy. We hated our stay in Singapore because of our experience here. If the owners would only just halve the number of rooms and double their size then they'd have a terrific hotel, rather than the upmarket prison cells they currently have.

Reviews.Title: “Things to prepare if you stay here...”
Reviews.Author: P0014
Reviews.Content: I think no hotels is so terrible that no one can stay in because if it is so... they would be out of the business by now. This hotel also... it's not that bad like all the complaints it gets. It has both pros and cons... the pros are that it is located within walking distance to the Little India MRT station. Just turn left once you get off of the hotel, cross the intersection and then turn left... only 5 minutes walk there. I believe the rate must be cheap as well since we paid only 10,000 Baht (USD 312) for 3 day package there (include the Bangkok-Singapore air-ticket, a double room for 2 nights and airport pick-up&drop off). However, the room is very small, there wasn't much space to put your bag nor your clothes (there weren't no closets - only 3 hangs from the wall and one clothes hanger). The toilet is quite small (4x4 tiles) as you can imagine from other reviews. The towels were with low-quality so you should bring your own there (They cannot dry you). From the picture, I thought the breakfast was buffet, but actually it is one set of breakfast so if you eat a lot - you can get something from 7-11 shop just next door. The blanket was not so warm so you shouldn't forget to adjust your room temperature before going to bed. That's all the comments I have from my experience. Oh, and the check-in time is 3 PM so if you go there earlier, just leave your lugguages at the hotel and feel free to walk around first.

Reviews.Title: “Small but excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravalMumma
Reviews.Content: The room was small but clean and very comfortable. The staff were excellent and went out of their way to upgrade our room at no extra cost when they saw that we were travelling with a baby. The location was very convenient and most importantly safe. Would stay here again on future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel I have been”
Reviews.Author: Bluering73
Reviews.Content: The room is so tiny that you can hardly find a place on the floor to put your luggage. Nosiest hotel I have ever been. 5 nights without being able to sleep at all. This hotel drives you crazy at night. The walls must be as thin a paper, Loud noise comes from everywhere at night up to one or two o’clock in the morning, corridor, neighboring rooms. Slamming of doors in the middle of the night, loud trolleys rolling along the corridor in the middle of the night, people shouting, loud talks, loud TV everything is amplified. It is really a mad house. I rang reception twice to complain about the madness going on at night, but they did nothing. I would not recommend this mad house to anyone. Just keep away.

Reviews.Title: “Room very small but clean”
Reviews.Author: sunflower725
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Selegie hotel for one day in Mar 2008, it is a small hotel and the room is macro small, esp the toilet, very small but the room is clean, the hotel staff are quite nice and helpful. If u are looking for a budgeted hotel then this hotel is quite ok coz the location is quite near to the shopping complex and hawker store. And i like the complimentary breakfast provided, its a westen breakfast set.

Reviews.Title: “Super Small Room, But Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WinnyThePooh
Reviews.Content: Stay for two nights. Don't have reservation when check-in since I hunt this property directly after moving from other hotel. Friendly reception staff, very helpful although the night staff a little bit snobbish. Good location - 3 minutes walk from Little India MRT, 10-15 minutes walk from Dhouby Ghout MRT, bus stop in front of hotel, 7in11 shop next door, safe area. My objection is that of the room size, it's so small especially the bathroom ( I called it the XS bathroom). Other than that everthing is okay, the room is clean, u get fresh towel everyday, u get hair dryer, the ac is good, and u get an LCD tv in the room. Breakfast is fine although the menu is the same every day, friendly staff here. A little bit pricey if I think about the room size, but for the location and convinience it's okay for a nice budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: Happy_ACE
Reviews.Content: I had just over my vacation in December with my family. The hotel we stayed was absolutely fantastic. We booked for a family room with 2 twin beds, suprised it's also had 2 bathrooms, was clean and tidy eventhough it was small but provided TV cum DVD player and the hotel also having a swiming pool, my childred were very enjoyed. The staff were helpful and good service. The breakfast provided also very nice. we only paid for SGD150++ per night. The location was very convenient, less than 5 mins walk to MRT station and the bus stop was just right outside the hotel. Overall I should say that this hotel is worth to stay and it was at a very good location. It just that i had choosen the wrong date to visit due to the rainy season in December.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: dizzyPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fragrance Selegie for three nights in Dec 2007. Read all previous reviews and took the chance. The rooms are micro small. (A new word for compact). You have to see the bathroom to believe it. The plus is that the shower is powerful. You can hear every noise from the corridors because of the tiled floor. It is ok for a couple of nights - wouldn't recommend anything longer. You have to live out of a suitcase - no wardrobe - just three hangers on a hook. No room to move around. The breakfast was good - just like the photo provided by a previous reviewer. It was served promptly and hot - with fruit juice, toast and spread, and tea or coffee. It is an average hotel if you work on the assumption "you get what you pay for". Ideally situated for Orchard Road - LIttle India and Bugis Road. Don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Aussieinengland
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before i booked this hotel and thought it must be nightmare (for some reason i still booked it???). Anyway, it wasn't nearly as bad as some of the reviews make out. You literally get exactly what you pay for. A bed, a shower and a toilet. Its all i needed for my stay and the staff were pleasant and helpful throughout my stay. The breakfast was always fine and the service there was always good. All in all i went in with low expectations and i was satisfied with my stay! BTW. One thing that is true, the rooms really are small, but i didn't need a big room.

Reviews.Title: “ok if your on a tight budjet.”
Reviews.Author: markh
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom are extreamly small. If your a single traveler like myself with ONLY check on baggage you will be ok. This room IS NOT for two people. In order to watch tv you have to lay in bed as its mounted on the ceiling. The swimming pool on the roof is nice but with only one chair. The hotel is a $18 cab ride from the airport and just a little more than that if you go after midnight. The big problem i had was that they WILL NOT let anyone check in before 3:00p.m. Everyday at around 2:00 the lobby is packed with people that have been there for who knows how long waiting. Then all of a sudden they start checking everyone in. So if your flight gets in early dont expext to get into your room right away. Breakfast was'nt bad in the morning as long as your on a diet. Not the buffet type that many south east asian hotels have. I will only stay here again if my budjet wont allow me anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: wairuapai
Reviews.Content: Was expecting it to be terrible but was quite suprised. Yes its small (bonus being you can shower and use the toilet at the same time!!) Yes you can hear everything outside your door. BUT its very clean, staff are wonderful - especially the cafe staff, you get free breakfast and there is a very clean, well maintained pool. Air conditioning unit was fine and the TV was good. Very minimal blankets though and the bed a bit hard, but for a budget hotel was pretty darn good. The area is fantastic for colour, safe to walk around at night and cant beat it for access to transport. Would definitly reccommend to people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Extra Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcr4v3r
Reviews.Content: Although there are lots of pro and cons from several reviews we read online about Fragrance Hotel at Selegie Road, we decided to keep the booking. The room rate was the most economical (considering it was still peak-season) and we booked it for 3 nights. We got there around 4:30pm, check-in (quite fast), and went to our room which was on the very same level with the lobby. We expected the room to be very small from reading the previous reviews. And yes, we would say that the room is best recommended for Asian tourists because of its petite size. Bathroom was very small; distance between the toilet, shower, and sink only about 10inches away. The nicest thing about this hotel was its extreme cleanness! Breakfast was ok, no buffet but the same pre-selected menu everyday (except they change the bread type every morning) . The waitress and waitresses are the nicest people over there. We asked for directions and they were so helpful in getting us the right one :) The biggest advantage of this hotel is the location. Very convenient, only 5 minutes away from Little India MRT station, bus stop in front of the hotel...and one of our favorites: Very close to Mustafa Center, the 24-hour shopping mall in Singapore! Couldn't ask for a better place than Fragrance Hotel in Selegie Road. Overall, we were pretty satisfied with this hotel. We will definitely recommend this hotel to our fellow backpackers or tourists who have limited budget and looking for the best money-can-buy accommodation :)

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: Londonboy61
Reviews.Content: I booked this place in last minute desperation as no other affordable rooms were available. Then I read the reviews on here and became concerned! However I found the Hotel fine. True It's not the HIlton (which I had in fact stayed in a few nights earlier in KL) but if you are travelling alone and need a place to sleep it's fine. The room is very small and so is the toilet/shower room but it was very clean. I was provided with two clean towels in the room and personally found the staff very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool was also very clean. All in all I was pleasantly surprised especially after reading the reviews on here, and btw the way I've travelled a lot and stayed in many different places and am not that easy to please!! Don't book this place if you are expecting luxury or space, but it does provide a clean comfortable nights sleep at a budget in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not the kind i expected”
Reviews.Author: JSoo
Reviews.Content: Negative:- Room way too small (Even smaller than a 2-star budget hotel in Kota Kinabalu,Malaysia) - Room suitable for dogs and frogs - Bathroom terrifically atrocious a.) Liquid soap dispenser is useless b.) No place to hang the clothes while having a bath. -Towel only available on request during second day ot stay. -Front counter staff is Mr.Don't-Know-It-All (Doesn't know where the National Museum is) -Bus stand right in front of hotel,no space for taxis to pick up and drop passengers (comments by taxi drivers) -Irregular temperatures of air-conditioner Positive:-Clean room -Well prepared breakfast -Not too noisy as stated in other reviews Close proximity to MRT Station,Orchard Road,F&B stores -Has luggage room to temporarily store luggage inside after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “abominable”
Reviews.Author: olcumdi
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before I arrived the hotel. But I thought that couldnt be like that. But I found something worse than comments. 4m2 hotel room. No seperate shower. it is combined with toilet. swimming pool is very dirty;. Staff looks friendly first, but they show their real face after.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: belle_tang
Reviews.Content: I totally agreed with review written by Townsville, Australia. Having read and expect that the smallness of the hotel room, I still had a good laugh when I was there. Still Pros: Location being about 5-8minutes from MRT little India and convenient bus stops near little india or Tekka mall for those using SBS 170 red plate from Johor, Malaysia to Singapore (thats the major reason why I choose this hotel). Staffs are friendly. Would I stay in this hotel again? Definately yes. Isabella (kuching, Sarawak)

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jcyh
Reviews.Content: Negative- Tiny rooms, no wardrobe, bathroom wayyyyy too small, smelly towels, noisyyyy, ill informed, inflexible staff- especially at the front desk Positives- Breakfast was good and fast. The staff there are very efficent (was told that the cafe are run by a different management, no wonder). Would only recommend this hotel to my worst enemy! This is my second time staying with the Fragrance Hotel chain (don't ask about the first one!) and trust me, don't stay there. I rate them 1 star for accomodation and 5 stars for the breakfast ladies!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodwitch205
Reviews.Content: my agency was fooled into thinking this is a pretty good business hotel. And, I have already reported it. Nobody could speak proper English at the reception, I asked for directions to the Rendevouz Hotel..I get told 3 times..'sure we can do your laundry'..oh well. I look for a bath to soak in, nothing. Ask reception where it is..and find out there is a shower right above the toilet. So, you end up removing towels or anything you dont want to get soaked. Great! And if you are a person with long legs, try sitting on the toilet sideways. helps not to squeeze your legs against the wall. Bed bugs! Galore! I am still scratching. If you smoke, you might need a mask, no ventilation, cant open the window. Three good things, you have a phone, a TV, and an air-conditioner. Space..hahahahaha! Quietness, nothing, kids running up and down the room above you or your corridor, and my most pet peeve..the breakfast service! Get cold toast and no butter..get coffee 10 minutes later..20 minutes, screaming for breakfast only to be told..oh sorry..we are busy! Thanks..but guess what? Me very hungry and want HOT food! So, bring me HOT everything RIGHT NOW!!! So, if you choose this hotel..good luck to you! (scratch scratch)

Reviews.Title: “Do not opt for this even if this is the last resort given by your agent”
Reviews.Author: inter-travel
Reviews.Content: Negative Features - ridiculously tiny rooms and bath area - Toilet, shower and wash basin, all installed within a tiny room of the size of a standard Indian toilet. - Half size wafer thin towels - No space for keeping the luggage. No wardrobe - Rooms are so tiny that if one person stands, the other has to sit. - The luggage has to be spread on the floor. I am yet to figure out how the house keeping guys would have cleaned the room with luggage on the floor - No considerations given to families with more than 3 members and the rooms are given for them in different floors - Deposit money of $5 collected for a tiny item like a multi pin adaptor and even that the guest is expected to pay at the reception and collect the item. - No bell counter to carry your loggage. Even senior citizens are expected to lug their luggage along with them. - Complimentary tea provided is not good for your palate. - Some of the reception staff are rude and uncourteous. - No feedback form or stationery kept for the guests - TV with no international channels other than HBO Positive features - Nothing found Tips to the tourist - Even if you have no other choice, do not opt to stay in this hotel, unless you enjoy tiny rooms after paying big bucks. If you still have to opt for this, ensure that you have no more than one small brief case with you and you don't do any shopping in Singapore as you will not be able to repack them in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are tiny!”
Reviews.Author: traveller_nz
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us this hotel and due to trade events going on at the time it was the best thing available within our budget so we agreed. I did a little research on the net before we were due to leave and only found a few reviews all saying the rooms would be small, but the rooms were tidy so I was kind of resigned to the fact that it couldnt be that bad...surely! On arrival the lobby looked quite pleasant and they had a computer room hooked up to highspeed internet for $1 for 15 minutes, which was quite reasonable. On entering our rooms we received quite a shock - the rooms are absolutely tiny. There is little room for baggage to be placed on the floor and there is no cupboards or drawers to store things, only one drawer in desk/bedside table. There is one telephone, one kettle, two packets of water (which were incredibly hard to open without a pair of scissors or sharp object) and two small biscuit or cake bars, one sachet of coffee and tea. One LCD TV with HBO which has a DVD player built into it. Two small towels are provided each day along with disposable toothbrushes and one shower cap. A liquid soap dispenser is attached to the bathroom wall. The bathroom or "wetroom" as I like to call it is the size of a small wardrobe or hallway closet. You can basically sit on the toilet, brush your teeth and shower at the same time! Good points: - handy location. Only a 2-3 minute walk to the nearest MRT station, Little India. And a 15 minute walk to Orchard Road. - tidy hotel, staff at reception are pleasant. - cafe is pretty average, staff are nice. - roof top swimming pool is quite nice. - rooms have air-con. Bad points: - rooms are tiny. - very noisy at night - ashtrays on each level next to each lift meant that at night smoke filled our room so had to use a towel to block the space under the door. Not very impressive! My advice: if you can afford better book elsewhere. If you have already booked, please take earplugs! The noise from the hallways is terrible so my earplugs were a saviour every single night. Apparently there are rooms in the hotel that are cheaper and do not come with windows. Be aware of this. And zip up your bags and lock them. I had an article of clothing go missing while staying in the hotel and although I am not accusing room staff of stealing, I have my suspicions.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, very noisy and tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: Richb2004
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute, but did get chance to read the reviews. However, it was not what I expected. First let me emphasize the size of the rooms. If you imagine a Japanese Pod room and expand it a little then you are thinking about right. The walls of the room are no more than 20 inches from the bed on two sides and on the others the bed is against the wall. The bathroom is also tiny. If you are anything other than of average size you may have problems. That is not the main fault. The worst irritant is the noise from the corridors. The corridors are very narrow and are tiled. This coupled with the fact that all residents seem to wear clogs produces a constant noise! Wheeled suitcases seemed to have amplified noise. We moved room after the first night, but there was no escape. The second room had water constantly flowing through one of the pipes in the wall. I didn't have it in me to ask for another change, as I felt a little sorry for the staff. That’s the bad stuff, which was enough for me never to skimp on hotels again. The good points are the location and the cleanliness. The Little India MRT station is a two minute walk. Orchard road is a short walk too. The room, although tiny, was clean. The room also has a TV with built in DVD player and a small selection of channels including CNN and HBO movies. The room is also equipped with two towels of modest size. A kettle is also in the room with a ration of coffee etc, but no spoon or cups that I could find. The leather bound (anti-pee) mattresses added to my discomfort. Breakfast is just about adequate, consisting of a tea or coffee, orange juice, two fried eggs, leaf of lettuce, two slices of meat and a potato thingy. However the breakfast area is extremely overcrowded with a queue of people constantly waiting to be seated. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and did their best to help. I felt sorry for them as I saw two other guests asking about changing rooms, whilst I was there. So, the hotel is clean, cheap, and in a good location. If you can handle the noise and don't mind very small spaces then this is the place for you, otherwise steer clear. I was tempted to give the review one star, but after reconsidering I figured that if you are a deaf midget then this might be ideal.
